Practical Information

Everything you need to know about attending StockholmFoss 2026

## Venue

KTH Royal Institute of Technology

Address: Brinellvägen 8, 114 28 Stockholm, Sweden
Main Hall: Aula Magna
Breakout Rooms: Sal A, B, C, D

## Getting There

T-bana (Metro)

Take the Red Line to Tekniska högskolan station. The venue is a 2-minute walk from the station exit.

Bus

Buses 50, 55, and 70 stop near KTH. Check sl.se for routes and schedules.

Bike

Bike parking is available outside all KTH buildings. Stockholm City Bikes (citybikes.se) has stations nearby.

From Arlanda Airport

Take the Arlanda Express to Stockholm Central, then the Red Line north to Tekniska högskolan (approximately 40 minutes total).

## Admission

Free Entry

No registration required. StockholmFoss is free and open to everyone. Just show up!

Doors open at 08:30. The opening keynote begins at 09:00.

## Food & Fika

Fika Breaks

Coffee, tea, and kanelbullar (cinnamon buns) will be provided during morning and afternoon breaks.

Sponsored by Redpill Linpro and Open Source Sweden

Lunch

Lunch is not provided, but there are many options nearby:

  • KTH student cafeterias (budget-friendly)
  • Restaurants along Drottning Kristinas väg
  • Food trucks in the KTH campus area
## Live Streaming & Recording

Watch Online

All talks will be live-streamed and archived for later viewing.

  • Live stream: media.stockholmfoss.se
  • Platform: PeerTube (federated, no tracking)
  • Archive: Available within 48 hours of each talk

No account required to watch. Share the stream with your local user group!

## Code of Conduct

Our Commitment

StockholmFoss is dedicated to providing a harassment-free conference experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or technology choices.

We do not tolerate harassment of conference participants in any form.

### Expected Behavior - Be kind and respectful to all participants - Use welcoming and inclusive language - Be mindful of your surroundings and fellow attendees - Alert organizers if you witness or experience harassment ### Reporting If you experience or witness harassment: 1. **In person:** Find an organizer (wearing a bright orange lanyard) or go to the registration desk 2. **By email:** coc@stockholmfoss.se 3. **Emergency:** Call 112 (Swedish emergency services) Reports will be handled confidentially. We will take appropriate action to address any violations.

Full Code of Conduct

## After-Party

Mingel & After-party

When: 18:00 onwards
Where: Nymble Student Union (2-minute walk from Aula Magna)
Address: Drottning Kristinas väg 15

First drink free! Sponsored by Polar and Mullvad VPN.

Cash bar available. Food trucks outside. Meet speakers, make connections, celebrate open source!

## Accessibility

Wheelchair Access

All venues are wheelchair accessible. Elevators are available in all buildings.

Hearing Assistance

Hearing loops are available in Aula Magna. Live captions will be displayed on screens.

Quiet Room

A quiet room is available for those who need a break from the crowds. Ask at registration.

Service Animals

Service animals are welcome at all venues.

If you have specific accessibility needs, please contact us at access@stockholmfoss.se and we'll do our best to accommodate you. ## WiFi

Network Access

Network: StockholmFoss-Guest
Password: opensource2026

Eduroam is also available throughout KTH if you have credentials from a participating institution.

## Weather Late May in Stockholm typically sees temperatures between 12-18°C (54-64°F) with long daylight hours (sunrise around 4:00, sunset around 21:30). Rain is possible, so bring a light jacket. The venue is fully indoors. ## Nearby Accommodation Stockholm has many hotels and hostels. Areas convenient to KTH include: - **Östermalm** - Walking distance, upscale options - **City Center** - 10 minutes by T-bana - **Södermalm** - 15 minutes by T-bana, many budget options Book early as May is a popular time to visit Stockholm!

StockholmFoss 2026

Saturday, May 23rd, 2026
KTH Royal Institute of Technology
Brinellvägen 8, 114 28 Stockholm

"Öppen källkod för alla"

Open source for everyone

StockholmFoss is a non-profit event organized by volunteers. All speakers donate their time.

No surveillance, no corporate capture, just FOSS.
